item.title: Bertrand's box paradox in Python
item.description: The paradox https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertrand%27s_box_paradox Analytical solution in Python import random import numpy as np # 0 represents a silver coin, 1 a gold coin b1 = [1,1] b2 = [0,0] b3 = [1,0] boxes = np.matrix([b1,b2,b3]) rounds = 100000 first = [] second = [] for r in range(rounds): box = random.randint(0,2) coin1 = random.randint(0,1) coin2 = abs(coin1 - 1) first.append(boxes[box,coin1]) second.append(boxes[box, coin2]) print(first) print(second) first = np.array(first) second = np.
